selected_quotes: Reason to be bugged: 1 in 3 patients with bloodstream infection gets improper therapy, Duke report says.
Are most hospital bloodstream infections community-onset? A recent study says they are
#PLOSONE: Bloodstream Infections in Community Hospitals in the 21st Century: A Multicenter Cohort
Bloodstream Infections in Community Hospitals in the 21st Century: A Multicenter Cohort

citation.abstract: While the majority of healthcare in the US is provided in community hospitals, the epidemiology and treatment of bloodstream infections in this setting is unknown.

news.title: Antibiotic Errors Common in Community Hospitals
news.summary: (MedPage Today) -- More than one patient in three treated for a bloodstream infection in community hospitals got inappropriate antibiotic therapy, researchers reported.

blogs.title: 1 in 3 community hospital patients get inappropriate bloodstream infection antibiotics
blogs.summary: More than one in three community hospital patients treated for a bloodstream infection get inappropriate antibiotic therapy, according to a new study published in PLoS One.read more

blogs.title: Bloodstream infections treated ‘inappropriately’
blogs.summary: An analysis of 9 community hospitals showed that 1 in 3 patients with bloodstream infections received inappropriate therapy. The study also revealed growing resistance to treatment and a high prevalence of Staphylococcus aureus bacteria in these hospitals.
